website_summaries.verdict: Nice boots to keep your feet warm in the winter, thanks to Thinsulate insulation and a lining that wicks moisture away, all at a reasonable price point.
pros: Uses a leather material that looks great, so they’re suitable for outdoor or indoor wear
Comfort level is higher than you may expect at this price point
Entire boot is sturdily built, but it also has some flex to it for comfort
cons: Durability is a significant question mark
Don’t seem to perform that well in below-zero temperatures though the brand claims otherwise

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy thin soles, don't keep your feet warm!!!
customer_reviews.text: The look and fit are okay, but they don't keep your feet very warm. The sole of the boots are super flimsy, it was the first thing I noticed. Then wearing them outside I could feel the cold coming up from the ground not to mention that since it's so thin you can feel every little bump. Not very good boots, I've gotten better for cheaper at Wal-Mart, too bad I didn't keep the box.
customer_reviews.author: Claude W.

customer_reviews.title: Completely terrible
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst purchase I have ever made on Amazon, an obvious example of fake reviews giving a false impression of the actual product. They are beyond uncomfortable. They are fairly warm, but it is so awful wearing them that the warmth is not worth it. The sole feels like walking with a plank of wood strapped to the bottom of your feet - absolutely no cushioning, no support, and no flexibility whatsoever. The size is slightly small, I'm between sizes and I got the larger size and it fits fine. I kept them hoping they would get better wearing them a few times, but they did not at all. DO NOT BUY THESE.
customer_reviews.author: G. Harris

customer_reviews.title: very poor quality from sloppy manufacturing...hard to unlace
customer_reviews.text: the side open loops to tighten the laces are a good idea, but the execution is awful. They are molded plastic and there is leftover material from burr, flash and nit-lines from the molding process. These are supposed to be cleaned up and removed but they are not. What does this result in? it makes it very difficult to unlace the laces in the middle open loop, which is there for quick access. Now i have to finish Kamiks job and go in there with an exactly blade to remove it, Much of the stitching is really sloppy and has loos strands. The cuts on the leather section are sloppy and not straight and have lots of strands falling off
customer_reviews.author: realistic reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Value isnt there, at all
customer_reviews.text: I worn them twice for 12 hours each of lineman work, not a good value for actual work, maybe just shoveling the driveway. Fit is small aswell. Id expect to pay around $50 for something like this, i spent $80 thinking it would be slightly better. My logic is flawed in this instance. Update: It actually feels like i have blankets on top of my feet (sweating) and barefoot underneath, literally no sole support whatsoever, I can feel every pebble under my feet and guess their size exactly. Im gonna try some dr sols insoles and hope for the best.
customer_reviews.author: Vantard

customer_reviews.title: Went from 5 stars to 1 star
customer_reviews.text: Have always given these boots 5 stars. Ordered 2pair this winter kept ordering a larger size because they are too narrow. Tried 3pair the last size was 13 I wear 11 tried a 12 each size is bigger is more narrower than the first. Always been very pleased year after year till now. The sizing just plain sucks. You can’t count on them being anywhere near the right size anymore. With don’t mean crap to China I recon
customer_reviews.author: henry smith

customer_reviews.title: so good. We're currently in the middle of the one ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. We're currently in the middle of the one of our coldest winters on record up here in Maine, so that's saying something! I primarily use these when I'm cleaning up snow in the driveway, and they've been great. Fit as expected, have good traction on snow and ice and are decently warm even in -20 degree or lower temperatures. I find the mark of good footwear is when you don't think about your feet at all while you're wearing them. That's the case with these boots. I hope they last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Cote

customer_reviews.title: Best winter purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots so I could walk around Chicago and Lake Michigan during the winter. These boots do not disappoint. I only use thin long socks with these boots and don't feel any cold. The Chicago slush is nothing to these boots. No water or snow get in them. Definitely the beat winter purchase I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Deadpool

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 9 in women's so I ordered these boots in an 8......fit perfectly! These boots are incredibly comfortable and warm. They're definitely not waterproof above the rubber/leather junction. I stepped in a puddle just barely above or right at the seam and felt the cold water in my boot. My only complaint is the laces are too long but not long enough to wrap around the shaft and then the unless you just knot it...at least for my arthritic hands. I should add that I have plantar fasciitis in both feet and have yet to add insoles. I am so glad I bought these boots.
customer_reviews.author: DonkeyMom

customer_reviews.title: Sole Hopelessly Thin
customer_reviews.text: Boots are advertised for -40 degrees, but the sole between the lugs is paper thin and very soft and flexible. You feel any rocks, ice or uneven ground, and the result is cold, uncomfortable, tired feet. I've had winter boots from Sorel, LL Bean and Scarpa, and they all have resilient soles that don't force your feet to adapt to every bump. The Kamiks are comfortable, but the soles make them non-starters.
customer_reviews.author: Massachusetts User

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boot for cold weather activities
customer_reviews.text: Test on a hike with wind chill at -24 and temp at 3, won't say my feet were comfortable, more like waling across a cold bathroom floor in the morning—but these were definitely up to the task. You can feel the ground, so I don't believe they offer exceptional protection against hard, sharp objects (like a sharp bit of metal fence post). But they were more than enough protection from sticks and rocks and, most importantly, the cold. When the snow was deep this is not an issue at all. I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: tekne

customer_reviews.title: Warm, but felt every pebble underfoot
customer_reviews.text: Is it even cold out? These boots kept my feet toasty without feeling hot in 25° weather for 3 hours, and could have gone much colder. And they were comfortable on smooth surfaces. But as for other surfaces? I felt every pebble, every small chuck of ice, every rut in the parking lot, etc., as if I were barefoot. But hey, I didn’t come home with frostbite. They were extremely comfortable on the sides and top of my feet, and the shaft of the boot was comfortable on my ankles. I’d probably recommend these for basic snow play with the kids in the yard, but not for anywhere that has uneven ground or pebble sized pieces of ice.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price but run bigger
customer_reviews.text: These were very reasonably priced. They are warm and waterproof. They run large. The uppers are soft / floppy. The combo of running a big bigger and having such a soft upper makes for a sloppy / unsupported ankle. Laces have intermediated locks so the fit is easy to manage. The insulation/ liner is attached so it doesn’t bunch going in or pull out when you take them off but can’t be removed for drying independently. Traction seems good. Haven’t had them long enough to comment on durability.
customer_reviews.author: MedIT

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: I used to wear kamik boots when I lived in Canada. I am very happy to have found them again on Amazon. They fit as I remember. They are best worn with thick socks and an arch support insole. They are comfortable enough but I learned long ago that these could be boots you forget you are wearing. Invest in the socks and insoles and you will have a boot that is as close to perfect as you're going to get. As for how warm they are? Don't wear them when the temps are around 50F. You will be far too hot. These boots are warm. Real warm.
customer_reviews.author: Buuurr

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted - soles could use more padding.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a large winter boot I could slip in and out of. This looked like a pair I used to have, and I'm happy to say it functions the same. The sides of the boots have a lot of padding so you can jam your foot in and out of them pretty easy. I hate having to re-tie shoes innumerable times a day. Soles could definitely use more padding. They seem thin to me. Dr Scholls oughta help there. But for the price, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: This boot feels much warmer and more comfortable on my foot than several other more expensive boots by more premium brands like North Face. Seems like the perfect budget boot for snow shoveling and anything that doesn't require more mobility. Like any shoe with an all-rubber bottom, it isn't very flexible. Reviews question whether it is truly waterproof and I can say from inspecting it that it doesn't have any kind of interior membrane like Gore-tex. Just the warm synthetic liner which is water-resistant, rather than waterproof. So the boot is only as waterproof as its leather exterior. Take care of that, and it will no doubt serve if you don't need to walk through a stream.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, warm and dry!!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 11 in regular shoes, 11.5 in running shoes, bought an 11.5 of these. I use them with custom inserts for extra support. I’ve put these through numerous trips thru the snow and shallow creeks, my feet were always dry and warm. I’ve hiked in them alone, in snow, but mostly while attached to a snowshoe. They are easy to put on and take off, comfortable to drive in, and have held up well. One season of use and they still look and feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D. Skirvin Jr.

customer_reviews.title: No possible way these boots are going to be comfortable at Sub-Zero temperatures.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect very much for the price, the boots were rated at -40. I've been running around in 30 degree weather cutting firewood. if you keep moving the boots are warm enough. I haven't been out in Sub-Zero temperatures with them yet. There is however cold radiating through the bottom of these boots at mild temperatures. They were worth 74 bucks but I won't be wearing them in Sub-Zero temperatures. They are very comfortable and seem to be well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, warm and dry at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are a great boot. Very well made, warm, dry and wear well. The size seems about right - I ordered a 1/2 bigger since I usually fit a size of 11 1/2 - I ordered size 12US and I have enough wiggle room for thicker socks. I’ve worn this out in dry compact snow and they have good traction; I’ve had them on in wet sloppy snow and my feet stayed dry and warm. I have walked the neighborhood (about 2 miles) in these Kamiks and they are fairly easy to walk in for being a bulky boot. I highly recommend these - especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: camaislnd

customer_reviews.title: If you have normal width feet these are fine, however
customer_reviews.text: If you have normal width feet these are fine, however, my feet are EE width and these DO NOT have nearly enough width for me. If you only need to wear them with one pair of light weight socks you might be ok. I tried going up in size I wear a 9.5 wide and tried a 10 (much too small), an 11 (better but still to narrow) and a 12 (much too long!) and could not get a good fit. I loved the look and feel of these boots. They are light weight but feel like they are well built. I would LOVE to have a wide version of these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Kamik Men's Nationplus Boot. Quality material and assembly, very sturdy, exactly like described, very warm with thick insulating removable liner. I wear a size 13 boot, bought a size 14 Kamik intending to wear thick winter weight socks, however there's only room for normal weight cotton socks with a snug fit; no problem due to the thick insulation, so I'm happy. I bought the largest size Yaktrax Pro Traction Cleats at the same time, excellent fit and work great on ice.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Rip and tear where the leather meets the rubber
customer_reviews.text: I've had these boots for two winters. They fit great and keep my feet warm. Well, they did, until they began to rip apart at the seam where the leather meets the rubber. I was walking my son to school one day when I felt my sock getting wet. The right boot had ripped at the seam and snow had gotten in. I examined the left boot and can see where it is beginning to rip also. Too bad. I liked the boots, but they're useless if they're ripped and leaky.
customer_reviews.author: Steven V.

customer_reviews.title: Coolest looking warm winter duck boot at a price under $100
customer_reviews.text: It isn't cold yet so I can't judge fitness for cold. Just unboxed item and I'm thrilled! Nicest looking pair of boots I've had in many years. I had to read a review to find out that these have a thinsolate booty built into "system", that is removable. I wear size 11. Ordered 11s despite reviews recommending I go bigger. These boots fit like snug slippers. I've been shopping for 2 yrs to find high end low price winter boot for walking my dog. If you need boots and don't want to look like a cartoon character, these are the ones. No bs, buy these puppies! Steve
customer_reviews.author: floridacarguy

customer_reviews.title: Good Winter Boots for Shoveling Snow or Outdoor Winter Activities
customer_reviews.text: I'm generally leery of buying shoes or clothing on line without the ability to try something on, or at least hold it against myself, (since my arms are disporportionately long, like an orangutan) and my feet are slightly different in size (which I've heard from shoe salespersons is not unusual). But these boots fit perfectly, are comfortable, easy to put on & remove, and will be good for shoveling snow this coming Michigan winter.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these boots I loved them, they were waterproof and warm! But as I've used them through this winter (less than 4 months) the loft of the liners disappeared and my toes began to get cold in 30 degree weather. The liner is not reallu6 removable, glued to the bottom, but I removed them and attempted to wash and dry them to refluff to no avail. There is also absolutely no foot support given, I had to add arch support insoles to be able to not be in pain the next day if I was using these to do barn chores.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Prince

customer_reviews.title: Great light snow boots.
customer_reviews.text: Great light snow boots. These boots fit a bit smaller than I expected, but are still great. I would have purchased a 1/2 size larger if it were available. The boots have a tall leather upper and metal eyelets/d-rings. The waterproof rubber lower is sewn into the leather upper, not just glued. The removable liner is lightweight and insulated with 200 g of Thinsulate. For a larger pair of winter boots these are very lightweight. I will absolutely buy another pair of Kamik boots in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Olson

customer_reviews.title: Not for hiking or working outdoors
customer_reviews.text: These are decent boots but there are two things I noticed immediately. First, the sole and the whole boot flexes very easily and offers next to nothing for toe protection or ankle support. Second, although they fit my feet well, the eyelets are placed too close together. Even with thick socks, when I pull the laces as far as they will go, the eyelets touch and the boot is still loose around the ankle. While they are warm and appear durable, they are definitely not appropriate for hiking or for work beyond snow shoveling.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: - 40  degree's  , they  were drunk .
customer_reviews.text: I work in Georgia (go Dawgs) bought boots because the price and THEY said -40 degrees , well here it never gets below 15 degrees so I thought it would be a good buy......Wrong ....only 25 degrees and a 50/50 pair of thick wool blend socks and my feet were cold. They look good , but so does a popsicle . BUT ,they are water proof or should I say sloppy watery mud proof and they worked well in weather above 30 degrees . would buy again ONLY for light hiking and walks around the park on medium cold days.
customer_reviews.author: doug jones jr

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear an 11.5 so I sized up so I could wear these with thick insulated socks and 12 worked fantastic. I could definitely use an 11.5 with normal socks fine but just went with an additional layer. Got this item and put them on for the first time during a trip to NYC during the snow and freezing rain and after 8+ hours of wear and trudging around in the snow/rain my feet were warm and dry! I highly recommend these boots to anyone in need of good winter boots. Can't beat the item for the price you pay!
customer_reviews.author: jackerton525

customer_reviews.title: 11W and Kamik size 12 is perfect with thick hiking socks
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers said, buy one size larger. I am a U.S. 11W and Kamik size 12 is perfect with thick hiking socks, in the very brief time I've worn them ( indoors, for half-hour session, since I live in Florida,where they were delivered this month , November). Will take them up north in December and use there. Construction and materials seem first-rate, price a fraction of most competitors. I think I know snow boots. Grew up in Canada. Lived there 43 winters. Going back for skiing much of this coming season. Think boots will be perfect in ski area parking lots and if stuck in snow drift in car.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot! Runs small in size
customer_reviews.text: Great looking boots! Fast shipping and good packaging. Size was TOO small! I'm a solid 11.5 so I got a 12 and still too small. Tips of my toes rubbed the front, but the heal was loose...tried lacing tighter and that didn't work. Thanks that amazon returns with no hassle! Ordered a different type actually. Didn't want to spend $35 more to go size 12 to 12.5. So I'm getting another Kamik style in size 13. $52. I'm not a cheap skate, just live in California and don't use them much.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Hugen

customer_reviews.title: Ordered one size larger than normal
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely Love these boots, right after I purchased them we had snow and a below zero cold spell. I had to scoop snow in -10 degree weather with wind chills approaching -40, my feet never even began to get cold!! It was the first time in memory that I was able to be out in that type of weather and not have cold feet!! LOVE THEM! I originally ordered the size of boots I have always purchased and when they came I had to return them and order the next size up. They are the most comfortable winter boots I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: HUSKERDUBY

customer_reviews.title: Very nice boots for MN winter.
customer_reviews.text: They appear to be very good build quality. They are a couple inches taller than pac boots I've had in the past which is nice. I normally where a size 12 shoe so I ordered a 13, which is perfect for a pair of heavy socks and then have some wiggle room for the toes. The price seemed almost too good to be true, we'll see how they hold up long term. Most of my snow boots last about 10 yrs before the rubber parts crack and start leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: High quality boot, warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my son. When he first put them on they seemed a bit snug but that was due to the insulated fabric not formed to his foot yet. He wore these in -20 *F and a lot of snow and ice. His feet stayed warm and dry. I'm hoping these last him for many years. You will notice they are made with high quality as soon as you open the box and pick them up. I'm very satisfied with my purchase and the price was decent also.
customer_reviews.author: MUDMUD

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, everything advertised and well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Where to start here....these are beyond a shadow of a doubt the warmest boots I have ever owned. They are very well built, waterproof to the top of the lacing, easy to lace and put on as well as take off....very important when you're in bibs or coveralls. They grip ice and snow very good too. They have a removeable washable liner as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: I liked these so much but they run super super small. Tried to exchange but double the price now
customer_reviews.text: These boot look amazing and the quality is the best I’ve seen in boots and a very long time. There just run so small, the neck is impossible to get my foot into. Called to return for bigger size, again I want these boots but price was more the twice what paid at first. Sad over this purchase, truly a great looking boot and you can see the craftsmanship . Would have lasted me the test of my life. I wasn’t sure how to grade this boot. If the size was even close I could make it a perfect 5 Star, but this size 11 is more like a 7 to 8 at most.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.R.

customer_reviews.title: and coupled with breaking the boots in better and lacing them tighter they should be GREAT in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the man who actually wears the boots :-). They were a LITTLE bigger than I expected, but the function of sock thickness plays a factor here too. I have a couple other pairs of "boots" - one a true boot, my Timberlake, and one a heavy duty Merrell Trail Shoe. Both are 12 1/2 and I wore a thicker sock with the Kamik boot. The heel slips up a little, but only a little, and coupled with breaking the boots in better and lacing them tighter they should be GREAT in the long run
customer_reviews.author: RosannaT

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Based on other reviews, I got men's size 10 when I normally wear 9.5. I'd guess that these boots are truly about size 9.75. The boots are fantastic. I wore regular socks and my feet stayed warm and dry while trekking around and shoveling for an hour in a foot of snow. These boots are serious footwear. They are huge! Though not too heavy considering their size. The tread is substantial and works great in powder. Haven't had a chance to test in other conditions. Overall these were a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Owens

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots for a Snowy Winter.
customer_reviews.text: Pros These high boots are perfect for winter wear. They do protect the feet from getting wet from snow and ice. They wear high above the ankle to keep the snow and ice out. They can keep your feet warm but only for a little while. Maybe half hour to an hour tops in continued exposure to snow. Good to wear when shoveling snow and giving a helping hand when cars are stuck in snow on the road. Con I bought one size bigger to allow for thick wool socks. You do need to wear thick wool socks because the boots do not protect your feet from getting cold when subjected to prolonged exposure.
customer_reviews.author: Dian Mangalapallil

customer_reviews.title: Bought one size to big from normal shoe size to ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought one size to big from normal shoe size to give room for heavier socks. Not a problem with even no extra socks are really required. I'd buy again with one size larger than normal. Bought for son, and he LOVES THEM. Plenty worm in NORTHEAST weather at 0 to 10, as tested last week. Hopefully won't get any colder to test these boot as that' cold enough for any human to bear with.
customer_reviews.author: Father of 2

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BOOT FOR ANY MAN TO OWN HUBBY LOVED THEM AS SOON AS HE PUT THEM ON, EVEN FOR THOSE PICKY MEN .
customer_reviews.text: NOTHING TO DISLIKE. THESE BOOTS ARE AWESOME . WAS GOING TO WAIT TILL CHRISTMAS BUT THEN WE GOT HIT WITH 13 INCHES OF SNOW. HUBBY NEEDED THEM FOR SNOWBLOWING. GREAT FIT ALL AROUND , KEPT HIS FEET WARM AND DRY FOR OVER 5 HOURS IN THE SNOW . PROUD TO BE A OWNER OF THIS PRODUCT AND STYLE OF BOOT. MY HUBBY IS ALSO A PICKY TYPE OF SHOE AND BOOT PERSON WHERE HE HAS TO TRY THEM ON . SURPRISE WIFEY KNOWS BEST ...... THANK YOU MUCH IF I COULD GIVE 100 STARS I WOULD . SIZES FIT TO THE SIZE . VERY COMFY AND WARM ,
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Slater

customer_reviews.title: Good boots. Very warm.
customer_reviews.text: The boots are very soft and warm. My only complaint is that they had little cushioning and support in the sole. A pair of inserts solved it but that makes the toes a little snug. But great boots otherwise. The size chart said I should order a 9.5. But that seemed too small. So, I originally ordered a 10.5 (US) as that is my normal shoe size. I should have trusted the size chart. The 10.5 was way too big. 9.5 is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: B. Kolar

customer_reviews.title: NOT TRUE TO SIZE ... RUNS TOO SMALL !!!!
customer_reviews.text: NOT TRUE TO SIZE ... ALWAYS BEEN A 13 W NOT EVEN CLOSE ... SAYS MADE IN CHINA WONDERING IF THAT IS WHY ... BOUGHT 3 XL HARLEY SHIRTS WHILR BACK SAME WAY VERY SAD WHEN YOU WAIT
customer_reviews.author: MOHAWK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot for the price! Had read some other reviews complaining that the boots were not warm and the rubber soles crack. I have found no issues regarding either. Being in New England I did not expect these $65 boots to keep my feet warm while standing in 20 below zero weather, you need to spend 3 times this price for that comfort. As for the soles cracking, maybe keeping the boots out of dry, high temps during storage would be smart. Overall I find that these boots are extremely comfortable, keep my feet warm/dry and are a great bargain at this price.
customer_reviews.author: RON

customer_reviews.title: Wow, these boots impress regardless of the cost
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from 4 hours outside at local ski resort. 25 degrees out. These were comfortable, my feet never got cold and never got sweaty. The thinsulate inner was perfect. At 1/2 the cost of my Sorels and what seemed to be a lighter boot, these were great. Longevity? We'll see. Solid construction, nothing looks or feels cheap. After reading some reviews I ordered 1/2 size larger than my 11.5. I ordered a 12. Perfect fit and still had room for my gym socks and a heavy thermal sock over that (which I didn't need). Glad I took a chance on a brand I had no experience with.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bridges

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING!!!! NOT -40 deg F worthy!!
customer_reviews.text: This boot claimed to be weather proof for extreme cold of "Minus 40F Temperature rated " , however when it was ONLY a temp of 32 def F (not minus) and in the snow, the boot did NOT keep the feet warm and toes were freezing in these boots. This is with wool socks on also!! Not as described and then was NOT issued a full refund due to wearing them. Which is BOGUS cause how are you supposed to know if they will legitimately keep your feet warm in cold weather if you do NOT wear them to TRY them out!!!!!!!! BAD COMPANY SATISFACTION!!!
customer_reviews.author: Oceandreams

customer_reviews.title: My Dad loves these
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my dad for upstate NY weather. He says these boots keep his feet warm for hours while he is taking care of the driveway. He doesn't usually have to deal with temperatures below maybe -10F, but frequently deals with a foot or two of snow. He hasn't stopped raving about them since Christmas. One thing he did mention is that they fit just about right now that he figured out how to put them on properly. They have a hook that loosens a middle lace to make it easier to get them on and then you reattach the lace. He also wears warm socks with these and can still fit his feet in.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Fit well and kept me warm
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a pair of winter hiking boots because I was going to be doing some snow shoeing at a near by ski resort. So this would be up and down hills as well as flat ground. They worked out well, I never felt as if my feet were cold and my feet did not hurt even after the 7+ miles we hiked.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L. Grigsby

customer_reviews.title: Warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: Very warm, very dry. Shoelaces are a bit long, but that is my only complaint. I broke these in during a snowshoeing trip in Mccall, Idaho, and my feet were very comfortable despite long trekking into the night through deep snow. Will update as they get more miles on them.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, great value
customer_reviews.text: This boot's upper is very well insulated, but the ground sucked the heat right out. Insoles solved the problem handily. The boot shaft diameter is pretty large, my pant legs would not fit over, so tuck 'em in. The rubberized lower means that it does not breathe, and if water gets in or sweat accumulates, you're going to need to dry it or risk mildew. We had a brute season here, big snow alternating with bone chilling temps, these boots were tested. They passed
customer_reviews.author: GCG3

customer_reviews.title: Way, way undersized.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this boots to fit. At $35.00 for size 12, I considered the price a steal. I wear size 11 shoes and figured that buying one size bigger would give me plenty of wiggle room. When I tried them on, it felt as though my feet were in a vise. My toes were squeezed together and jammed to the front of the boots. I would strongly advice ordering two sizes larger than normal. If size 13 wasn't so expensive I would order them this very second. Nice boots but the company needs to rethink the sizing.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Hiner Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to buy something like this?
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awesome. I don't live in Alaska, but in WNC we can get a foot of snow quickly every now and then. We got 14 inches a couple weeks ago, and these boots arrived just in time. WARM and DRY feet for the first time for me! Why did I wait so long to buy a boot like this? My wife stole them, my 12 year old stole them...but they are MINE. I'll only wear them a few times a year, but when I do...oh yeah. My feet are done growing. Peace out.
customer_reviews.author: imabuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, warm and dry.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to go to Iceland in February. It snowed for a week straight. went glacier hiking and even to the beach and they were much more comfortable than I hoped they would be. I went up a half size and they fit great. Sloshed around in nearly frozen puddles, snow, ice, and sand.
customer_reviews.author: OJ Gator

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality at a good price. I would have ordered a half size larger, but I chanced it, due to the additional $20 extra charge for the larger size. Fortunately, the boot is warm enough you can get away with wearing basic normal winter socks. I take a size 10 (ordered same size) and with all the reviews I read, it looks like if you have a wide foot, you may want to consider going with the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: HP

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm foot wear
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awesome.... At work, I walk foot patrols in a region that is extremely cold on Security Details. These boots fit comfortably, and my feet are always warm and dry regardless of snow or rain in my SECTOR. I'd highly recommend these boots for your work, Hunting or recreational needs.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Lowry

customer_reviews.title: not warm
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to have a great review for these boots but they didnt keep my feet warm. I was very surprised because from all the reviews were good. So far I used them once and my expectations were high, they fit great even with a thicker sock great traction but they did not keep my feet warm and the weather was 30o.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Arias

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Warm, comfortable. Easy to clean. Feet stayed dry all winter. Easy on and off. Reasonably light weight. Will buy these again and again as needed. Work outdoors and kept feet warm in sub zero temps (used thicker wool blend socks when necessary). Wish I would have tried these years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Kman

customer_reviews.title: Light and warm...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots 2 years ago. I have worn them perhaps 40 days in snow and cold. Mine are 2 sizes larger than normal. I got 14 but normally wear 12-12.5. The 14s fit great. They are warm, light and sturdy. I took the liners out each day I wore them and dried the boots with electric boot dryers each night. I got them in the late winter so they were $40. What a great boot for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots to go elk hunting. I bought them a half size larger than needed in order to be able to layer socks, and I was able to wear a pair of thin socks along with 2 pair of wool socks. My feet kept warm and dry, and despite getting these the day before leaving for hunting I hiked MANY miles in the mud and snow in them and got zero blisters! I was pleasantly surprised by the comfort and quality of these boots - definitely a great value (I'd easily spend $150 on them vs the $80 I spent on them)
customer_reviews.author: Rodeogirlusa

customer_reviews.title: First pair didn’t last, but easily replaced and second pair is great
customer_reviews.text: Update 1/30/2019 : company was great to deal with. Quickly sent a replacement pair, and these have been great this winter and look like they will last a long time. Boots are warm and fit as expected, but didn’t last. I wore them maby a dozen times this winter before the uppers split from the bottoms, about a month after the return window ended. Would have been nice boots if the had lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great boots but as other reviewers indicate size up!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 12M shoes and was debating sizing up and decided to get the 13 and was not disappointed. The 13's fit great and a warm and snug. There is an insulated lining insert that would make them a bit more snug if you went with the normal size plus they seem to run about half a size smaller than a sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: eb

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit amazing and are super warm. I'm a size 10 and the boots fit well, a little extra room around the toes which is nice. I put my own sole at the bottom of the insert and now it fits snug but comfortable, and it feels like I'm wearing sneakers. The insert does come out but not when you take your foot out, you have to remove it manually if you want to take it out to wash it. I highly recommend these, not too pricey either. I bought a cheaper pair, saved $30 but they looked cheap, and these are far superior in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick B

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband to use during our (very) cold, snowy winters. He says they're very comfortable (fuzzy and cozy on the inside) and keeps his feet warm, even in sub-zero temps. The grip on the bottom is perfect for maintaining traction while shoveling and the height on the boot is great even in deeper snow. We would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ALLFLUKSD

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfortable, and warm
customer_reviews.text: We we're hit with a nasty winter storm just weeks after I got these boots. I spent hours walking around in 8" of snow clearing downed tree limbs on our property. These boots kept my feet warm and dry the whole time. My feet tend to get pretty cold in cold weather. With a good pair of socks I was fine in 25 degree weather for extended periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: jnetTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Serves me well...
customer_reviews.text: These replaced an old pair of Sorrels for me. Surprisingly light weight and serviceably warm, I feel these are superior boots at a cheaper price. Functions well as a cold weather chore boot and I enjoy them in the forest and brush as well. Very comfortable; I would absolutely get another pair of Kamiks once these wear out. (But I suspect that will take years...) Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Harbor

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy them, very poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: Within just a couple of weeks of wearing the boots the heal of the felt liner had worn through.The boots did not have an innersole either.For that reason I do not recommend nor will we buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Luis martinez

customer_reviews.title: I'm a woman size 8 got these in size 6
customer_reviews.text: As a woman, everyone around me commented that the boots "were too masculine" but who cares because I was the only bitch whose toes didn't completely become popsicles. This is my first New York Winter with them. They are very heavy, don't try to run with them. When it comes to sizing they fit for a very slim sock which sicks. All the padding inside you cannot wear very thick socks at all. You can try to get a larger size and see if that makes a difference. They are also extremely waterproof. The lining on the inside is fantastic. In February/ March I can update you on how it went for these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Warm, when moving. Water resistant, not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Boots are comfortable and warm if you’re moving. At temps from 26-34degrees, I sat for 2-3hours at a time hunting in Appalachia with 3 or 4 layers of socks on. My feet still got cold, which is why I only sat for 2-3 hours. And the “waterproof” claim is more like “water resistant”. The rubber bottom is obviously water proof but the upper material wicks in water and moisture. You can pull the liners out and throw them in the dryer. These would probably be great for shoveling or snow plowing all day, or playing with the kids in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I felt like they were a size 8
customer_reviews.text: My boot size is usually a 9- 9 1/2 wide width. These boots did not come in wide widths so I ordered the size 9 and it was a big mistake. These boots were way too narrow and very difficult to try get on. I felt like they were a size 8. I gave a 3 star because it would be a great boot if they offered wide widths.
customer_reviews.author: Geri H.

customer_reviews.title: good boots
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid hunter and hiker who spends at least 5 days a week during the winter tromping around the mountains. I have only had these boot for a week, but have worn them every day. They are NOT hiking boots, although I covered five miles of rough terrain yesterday in them. But, they are warm and comfortable, it was six degrees when I was out today. As with any winter boots, keeping your socks and the boot liners dry is key. If I am going to hike for an hour and then stand still for a hour, I change my socks after the hiking part..............they seem well made and durable, we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: byron eckardt

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these because of the great reviews and was not disappointed! My husband had been searching for a durable and comfortable pair of boots to wear while snow blowing and shoveling that would keep his feet warm and dry. He's pretty picky and had tried much more expensive Uggs and other brands. Then decided on these. These were 1/4 of the price...much nicer and more comfortable. He wears an 11 1/2 and ordered a 12. They fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: These boots fit great are warm as can be and are just what ...
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit great are warm as can be and are just what I wanted and needed. As far as other complaining about the lace up or difficulty getting them on an off. Maybe they need to go back to Kindergarten and re learn how to lace your shoe? I don't find an issue with it because I looked at the pictures and understood what I was actually buying plus I am no so lazy that I can not tie my laces. I would buy a pair for everyone in my clan if I had the money.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: The only problem...
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. The warmth is there and the soles are sturdy. As some other reviews mention though,the only complaint is that the backs are pretty flimsy. If i don't have thick socks or long johns tucked in they bite the upper ankle a bit. I did put silicone sealer on them which stiffened then up a little but I learned thick socks or long johns. I would buy again though as they are some of the warmer ones I've had.
customer_reviews.author: RogerB.

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit perfectly! I where three pairs of socks, and since I bought one size bigger, they are great. Easy on and off, the liner is comfortable, and my feet have never been cold, ever. I treated my suede with a fabric protector, and it has resisted mud and dirt beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Pops

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for snow at amazing price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for snow blowing & shoveling. Used them during the 40-in storm we had this year when I was pretty much knee deep for two days blowing & shoveling out me & neighbors. Feet stayed perfectly dry and warm throughout the +6 hours spent in the mess each day! Also loved the snug but comfortable fit as my feet didn't "skate" inside when on slopes or quickly changing direction with the blower. Considering price & function of these boots...you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: trishal

customer_reviews.title: Good boots for snow
customer_reviews.text: Product fit well and liner kept my feet warm in the snow. I wouldnt recommend for casual wear. These are definitely boots made for a specific task. After standing still in the snow a while my feet got a little cold but not freezing.
customer_reviews.author: J. England

customer_reviews.title: Warm with Nice Soles
customer_reviews.text: These are "non-fashion" boots for my wife. I've had the same NationPlus boots for a year and we both like them for working in snow around the yard. The boots are warm, the soles are reasonably slip resistant, and the price is good. Overall a very nice snow boot.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Boot!  Super Comfortable and Warm!
customer_reviews.text: While I have only used these boots on one trip, it was 10 days in Garmisch during the winter. They are super comfortable, warm, and seem to be durable. The tread kept me from slipping on the ice more than my wife's Sorels did.
customer_reviews.author: JAY H.

customer_reviews.title: Not a good value
customer_reviews.text: There is one reason to wear winter boots -- to keep your feet warm. These boots fail miserably. I spent 3 hours moving snow in 30 degree weather in these boots and two pairs of socks: not much of a challenge, right? Well, my toes were ice-cold when I finished. I don't know how they will wear, but I hope poorly so that I can replace them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Danielson

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this purchase. I needed a pair of Snow boot for a trip to Canada, and I did not want to spend a lot, since I may never use them again. These were perfect!! These performed well to around 0° f. There were a couple of times my feet did get cold, but I was standing still for long periods of time and it was after my toe warmers were no longer working. I'm sure there are warmer boots out there, but for the money these performed great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Left Feet
customer_reviews.text: Well both boots were LEFT foot and the size 10 is small to size. I will need a 10.5 to fit and of course one LEFT boot and one RIGHT boot so I can wear both at the same time. OH and to my disappointment, now the only "exchange" boot in the right size is a much higher price than what I paid. Boot looks good other than these "minor" issues.
customer_reviews.author: Patton

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this boot 5 stars, but the upper eyelets are snaps and have a tendency to come unsnapped. Once this happens, they will not snap back closed making it a pain in the butt to tie the laces. I simply put a little epoxy in between the snap and clamped close with a vise grip to remedy. But one shouldn't have to do that. Aside from that, these boots are awesome! Fit great, grip very well on packed snow and ice keeps the feet very dry.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur W. Bethel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boot. Great price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boot for the cold and wet. I live in Wyoming and it gets cold here. I used these to move snow on my tractor and wore them for hours and my feet stayed nice and warm. Do yourself a favor buy these they are nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jbarth

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot for the price
customer_reviews.text: Since they don't have half sizes i ordered a size 10 as I usually wear a 9 and wanted room for thick socks. The boots fit well even with semi-thick socks. construction seems well made. So far after half winter season seems to be a good boot for the money.
customer_reviews.author: E. Peete

customer_reviews.title: run small
customer_reviews.text: order one size larger I orderd lager for extra pair of socks but were too small but fit right with one pair mine size is 13 very lite and can drive with them pervit for out side shovling or to and from fishhouse I live in minn so standing on ice my feet did get chilled but I have heavy lacross for standing on ice or fourwheeling to lake and back if I get 2 years ill be happy seem well built
customer_reviews.author: hunter

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good - buy the next size up
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Plenty of strapping (ties) to fit the foot Removable insert - fits really tight Lightweight CONS: Buy a size larger than normal Does not 'stand' well (boot bulges above the ankle) unless you tie it VERY tight
customer_reviews.author: Tim Deaton

customer_reviews.title: they bend very well and are comfortable once you get use to them
customer_reviews.text: Man, I bought 3 different boots including two higher end ones (by name) and more expensive....but these are definitely worth the positive reviews and comments. they bend very well and are comfortable once you get use to them.....they are like moon boots with thick padding, but once your in they become very nice. Pleasantly suprised.
customer_reviews.author: prowl

customer_reviews.title: Best budget boot for -40F, bar none.
customer_reviews.text: There are better boots out there, yes, but they'll easily cost twice as much. These are far superior to anything else in this price range. Spent much of the morning digging cars out of the snow, and my feet stayed warm, dry, and comfortable the whole while, even with cheap old cotton socks on underneath. Arch support leaves a bit to be desired for flat-footed folk, but that's the only black mark I can point out on what is otherwise a phenomenal snow boot.
customer_reviews.author: Chester Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Get this boot to stay warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: They fit a little big. Super comfy, my feet stay warm and dry. You can’t tie them all that tight. I just wear them like a slipper that’s to big. Good in the snow. My feet stay dry, I don’t slip on the ice. Super high cut, snow can’t get in. Should have got a size smaller. Don’t care, love them.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality and Warm!
customer_reviews.text: These boots have been used every hunt since I bought. They fit perfect as expected and keep your feet warm. Recommendation for maker..... Add thicker sole with more cushion. Thick socks not needed but recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: The padding is great they are warm and dry from toes to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for hubby and I will be getting a pair for myself. The padding is great they are warm and dry from toes to the top. Feel like ski boots but are flexible enough for playing with the kids in the yard. Or just walking around town. You will not be upset with fit or feel
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Warmest boots I’ve ever warn!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are super soft and comfortable. They ready to wear and don’t need to be broken in. They’re also crazy warm. If you’re going to be using them for just physical activity they may even get too hot for you. My feet are roasting if I shovel my driveway. Great for people with cold feet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not super warm
customer_reviews.text: i wear a size 10.5, bought size 11 for the added space for thicker socks, fit nice and snug with the thicker socks. only problem i have with these boots is that i bought them for hunting and sitting in a tree stand staying still for hours is very hard with these boots in colder temps, it was 27 degrees when i wore them and in less than a half an hour of sitting my feet were so cold i was in pain. they may work great if you're constantly moving but sitting still you can feel the cold rising from the sole of the boot. i recommend toe warmers if you intend to hunt with these boots
customer_reviews.author: Hotrodwolf

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and very warm
customer_reviews.text: After waiting for several chances to wear these boots in sub zero temps, I can now say with absolute confidence these boots fit great and they keep my feet warm! I am between a size 91/2 to 10 and a "D" width so I ordered a size 10. With a single wool sock, these boots fit perfect! No pinching at all and ample room should I want or need to wear a thicker wool sock.
customer_reviews.author: MTPaul

customer_reviews.title: Best value.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered sizes 9.5 and 10 since I wear a 9 in most sneakers. Both fit the same. Got 2 ft of snow yesterday, have worn the 10's 24/7. Cold yesterday, medium socks, feet toasty warm in 3 ft drifts. Good grip and traction going up steep inclines. Today, warmer, thin socks, still toasty and firm while shoveling and blowing snow all day. I'm gonna keep the 9.5's as backup. Curious to see how long these last, but for what I paid, they more than measure up. True to size? It depends.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia K Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these boots a few times in deep snow. They keep my feet very warm and I found I didn't need to add thick socks even on very cold days. My feet have always stayed dry. They are surprisingly light for such a big boot.. They feel a bit stiff when you walk in them but that probably comes with the territory. I'm really happy with them and so far after limited use they are holding up well. Update: more than a year later they are still holding up well with occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: N. R.

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable boots!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I can stay outside all day (and I have) in these boots and my feet stay warm and dry. They also do not rub at the back of my heels like other boots do. Easy to get on and off. Great to wear to a football game or walk around Santa's Village in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: joeshmoe

customer_reviews.title: Good all around
customer_reviews.text: Extraordinarily warm. Snow might accumulate a bit at the top when doing some vigorous activity in the snow such as sledding, but never penetrates deeper than the very top even with vigorous activity. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A tad tight.
customer_reviews.text: Only 4 stars because they are a little tight. Not too bad but i did order a size up so i was expecting them to be a little looser. Overall though, they are very comfortable and quite pleasant to have on. Granted, the temp has been unseasonably warm since they arrived with no snow so I’m still waiting to give them a proper “test drive”.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This is a great snow boot
customer_reviews.text: This is the last snow boot I'll ever need. It is a heavy-duty book best (in my opinion) for snow greater that 3". Warm and sturdy. I sized it based on a 12.5 running shoe I use; probably could have gone with the 12 in this boot. Not an issue, I just put on an extra pair of socks. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Dennito

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Bought for husband who usually wears a 13W, but very few winter boots come in wide sizes so took a chance on these (and a few others) in a 13 regular. These were not even close to fitting; too small everywhere even with thin socks.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney

product_meta.title: Kamik Men's Nationplus Boot
product_meta.description:
Kamik keeps feet warm, cozy, and dry with a style that smoothly transitions from outdoor to indoor wear.

Kamik comes from a place of extremes. Where the harshest conditions intersect with some of the most beautiful sights you'll ever see. At Kamik, we make footwear that brings to life our northern origins. Singular. Strong. Simply dependable. We've been doing it for over 100 years. Day after day. 24/7. The result of all this effort: a complete line of outdoor footwear built to deliver superior comfort and reliable protection in the most extreme conditions. We know you wouldn't have it any other way.
feature_bullets: Kamik keeps feet warm, cozy, and dry with a style that smoothly transitions from outdoor to indoor wear.
